subject: Re: [junit] JUnit not matching to my needs - execute order sh ows design flaw ?
msgSnippet: ... I think that s not too bad a kludge, actually, though I d really prefer to have the information closer to the tests. However, what about those of us who
messageBody:
On Mon, 12 Jul 2004, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> To me, that sounds like a test results filtering problem, so I would put
> my attention there for a simple solution. An XSL stylesheet that looks
> for that one test result and highlights failures in big, bold red
> letters would be easy (we know how to do it), and effective, if not perfect.

I think that's not too bad a kludge, actually, though I'd really prefer
to have the information closer to the tests.

However, what about those of us who work with the command-line testrunner?

cjs
--
Curt Sampson <cjs@...> +81 90 7737 2974 http://www.NetBSD.org
Don't you know, in this new Dark Age, we're all light. --XTC
